stem: What is the name for the computers in a Kubernetes cluster that can run your workloads?
options/3/rationale: Sorry, that's not correct. (In self-managed Kubernetes clusters, you can configure a control plane to also run your workloads in addition to its responsibilities as a control plane, but it's not the default, and this configuration is not possible in GKE.)

stem: What is the relationship between Kubernetes and Google Kubernetes Engine?
options/0/title: Google Kubernetes Engine is Kubernetes as a managed service.
options/1/title: Kubernetes and Google Kubernetes Engine are two names for the same thing.
options/2/title: Google Kubernetes Engine is a closed-source variant of Kubernetes.

stem: Which of the following supports scaling a Kubernetes cluster as a whole?
options/1/rationale: Sorry, that's not correct. Even though GKE uses Compute Engine to provide its resources, the capability to scale a cluster is provided by GKE itself. Attempting to scale a GKE cluster using Compute Engine tools would be an error.
options/2/rationale: Sorry, that's not correct. The capability to scale a Kubernetes cluster is provided by GKE.
